triana.types.util

Class Str

  • java.lang.Object
    • triana.types.util.Str

  • public final class Str
extends java.lang.Object
    Str is a class which contains static functions which perform a number of useful repetitive function in java. e.g. when converting from a String to a float, you just simply type in :-

    myfloat = Str.strToFloat(str);
    instead of
    myfloat = Float.valueOf(str).floatValue();

    The latter, I find really annoying! The routines here therefore colate a number of frequently performed procedures and provide shortcuts to their operation.

    Also, there are routines for counting the line numbers and finding and replacing etc.

      • niceDateAndTime

        public static final java.lang.String niceDateAndTime(java.util.Date d)
        Returns:
        a "19 Mar 1997" type format of the date. Gets rid of the time etc. Give new Date() as argument if the current time and date is needed.

      • replaceNext

        public static java.lang.String replaceNext(java.lang.String theString,
                           java.lang.String text,
                           java.lang.String newText)
        Finds the next occurence of the given string text from the string theString and replaces it with the newText. This should be used with caution: it uses a counter to keep track of how many occurences there have been, but this counter will be advanced by any call to this method, even one that searches a different String. It is safer to use the version with the position argument and keep track of the position in the calling program.
        Parameters:
        theString - the String to scan
        text - the text to find within theString
        newText - the String to replace text with
        Returns:
        the String after replacement

      • replaceNext

        public static java.lang.String replaceNext(java.lang.String theString,
                           int pos,
                           java.lang.String text,
                           java.lang.String newText)
        Starting at the given position, this method finds the next occurence of the given string text from the string theString and replaces it with the newText.
        Parameters:
        theString - the String to scan
        pos - the starting index within the given string
        text - the text to find within theString
        newText - the String to replace text with
        Returns:
        the String after replacement

      • insertString

        public static java.lang.String insertString(java.lang.String theString,
                            int pos,
                            java.lang.String text)
        Inserts a String into a given String at a given position. The insertion is made so that the first character of the inserted String will be at the given position in the returned String. If the given position is not within the initial String (negative or too large) then the original String is return without modification.
        Parameters:
        theString - The String to be modified
        pos - The index at which the insertion is to be made
        text - The insertion String
        Returns:
        The modified String

      • removeSubstring

        public java.lang.String removeSubstring(java.lang.String theString,
                               int from,
                               int to)
        Removes a substring from the given String and returns a String consisting of the remaining parts concatenated.
        Parameters:
        theString - The String to be modified
        from - The index of the first character to be removed
        to - The index of the first character that remains after the removed String
        Returns:
        The modified String

      • replaceAll

        public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.lang.String theString,
                          java.lang.String text,
                          java.lang.String newText)
        Replace all occurances of text with newText from theString.
        Parameters:
        theString - the string to scan
        text - the text to find within theString
        newText - the string to replace text with
        Returns:
        the new String after all the relevant text has been replaced

      • noLineChars

        public static int noLineChars(java.lang.String str,
              int pos)
        From the specified position in the String this function returns the number of characters excluding line feeds for this position. JTextAreas don't seem to use line feeds for example.

      • howMany

        public static int howMany()
        gets number of replacings made by the replaceAll function.

      • splitTextBySpace

        public static StringVector splitTextBySpace(java.lang.String text)
        Splits the text by items separated by white space

      • splitText

        public static StringVector splitText(java.lang.String text)
        This function splits the text into a vector of lines contained within that text i.e. splits the text on the newline character.

      • printVector

        public static void printVector(java.util.Vector v,
               java.io.PrintWriter pw)
        Prints a vector one element after another with a new line between each element.
